greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of Motzkin n-paths with exactly one flat step.
comment: An aerated version of A001700, which is the main entry for this sequence.

Number of paths in the half-plane x>=0, from (0,0) to (n,1), and consisting of steps U=(1,1) and D=(1,-1). For example, for n=3, we have the 3 paths: UUD, UDU, DUU. - _José Luis Ramírez Ramírez_, Apr 19 2015
reference: Jerome Spanier and Keith B. Oldham, "Atlas of Functions", Ch. 49, Hemisphere Publishing Corp., 1999.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened

Kiran S. Kedlaya and Andrew V. Sutherland, Hyperelliptic Curves, L-Polynomials, and Random Matrices. In: Arithmetic, Geometry, Cryptography, and Coding Theory: International Conference, November 5-9, 2007, CIRM, Marseilles, France. (Contemporary Mathematics; v.487)
formula: a(n) = binomial(n,(n+1)/2) for n odd, 0 otherwise.
E.g.f.: I_1(2z), where I_1 is the hyperbolic Bessel function of order 1.
G.f.: z*C(z^2)/(1-2*z^2*C(z^2)), where C(z) is the g.f. of Catalan numbers. - _José Luis Ramírez Ramírez_, Apr 19 2015
a(n) = Integral_[-Pi,Pi] cos^(n+1)/(2^(n-1)*Pi). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 12 2018
example: a(5)=10 since the coefficient of z^5 in I_1(2z) is binomial(5,3)=10.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ n! BesselI[ 1, 2 x], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Mar 19 2014 *)
program: (MAGMA) &cat[[0, Binomial(n, (n+1) div 2)]: n in [1..50 by 2]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 20 2015
results.author: _Andrew V. Sutherland_, Mar 16 2008
ext: New name is a comment by _David Scambler_, May 02 2013. - _Peter Luschny_, Mar 18 2014
